website_summaries.verdict: This pole trimmer has a 20-inch double-action blade and a long reach to get higher branches and growth.
pros: Uses a G-MAX 2 ampere hour, 40V Li-ion battery system powers, which is compatible with other Greenworks tools
Pivoting head adjusts to 3 positions for high, low, and hard to reach angles
cons: Must push 3 levers to make run

customer_reviews.title: battery held up fine, but again we used the Sthil on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to supplement our Stihl. Used it for the first time last weekend to prune the tops of a 25 foot row of shrubs. The blades were sharp enough to get the job done, battery held up fine, but again we used the Sthil on the sides. Not as heavy as the gas powered trimmer I rented last summer. Based on this one usage, I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: david fazio

customer_reviews.title: This is the biggest peice of JUNK I HAVE EVER PURCHASED ON AMAZON !!!!
customer_reviews.text: The blades on this trimmer are made of junk soft cold rolled steel and burr up and stop the blade movement. I ran it for maybe 2 mins tops and the this happened.... and I was trimming SOFT HEMLOCK !! GREENWORKS should be ashamed of themselves for selling this. customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: Great Product. Good Battery Life. Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I needed a replacement for my Mantis Electric Pole Trimmer (plug in) that died due to mechanical failure in the trimmer head. I have 3 sets of bushes that are 10' - 14' tall and a pole trimmer is a must. This trimmer is half the weight of the Mantis and with no cord, a breeze to work with. Had no problems going through 1/2" branches and the battery lasted the entire job (2-3 hours off and on) with plenty to spare. The trimmer is a little top heavy but I'll take that trade off for the overall lower weight. First time trimming in 15 years that my arms and shoulders weren't sore the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Timko

customer_reviews.title: Save your money  This is junk
customer_reviews.text: I used this item for a total of 20 minutes over a couple of weeks. The second time i used it, the blade jammed. I contacted the manufacturer and was 124th in line. When they did talk to me, they took the information, put me on hold, and when they came back, they disconnected me. They did not call back. Amazon took care of the problem by issuing a refund. Another example of Amazon's great customer service. We can summarize that if my call was 124th in line, they are having major problems with their equipment. Perhaps they should revisit their business plan.
customer_reviews.author: artie

customer_reviews.title: Good battery life
customer_reviews.text: It is heavy. That's my only negative comment about the trimmer. But, excellent for tall hedges because the blade bar pivots to 90 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. James D. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Am pleased with this product and quality. Arrived when said it would packaged well. It is heavy though. I have several shrubs that are 5 ft or higher and I have to balance this thing with my forearm due to the weight. I like it. It works well. Battery life is good but the weight is noticeable for sure. I'll probably use a few yrs to feel like I got my money worth then find another one not as heavy.
customer_reviews.author: amac

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one purchased
customer_reviews.text: I have a Greenworks 24V pole hedge trimmer that last 5 years. New 40V keep jamming up on small twigs and won't cut anything, even the small stuff. Battery is powerful but useless if I can't trim the hedges. Haven't had time to try and return it so I can't say anything about customer service. Just a heads up. Maybe I just got a defected one!
customer_reviews.author: George P

customer_reviews.title: Not used for
customer_reviews.text: I live on a gravel pad on the side of a mountain so I cannot use a lawn mower or weed wacker because it throws rocks everywhere so to remove the weeds I have used the hedge trimmer upside down as a lawn mower for the removal of all the annoying weeds and tall grasses from the pad. Works very well in this application so for those who cannot use a weed wacker this is the next best thing. A modification to the handle would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Seguin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent trimmer but heavy
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time & well packaged. Instructions were clear. Battery charged as expected. It made quick work of the rhododendrons I’ve used it on. Will get more use later in year. I found it heavy & it required focus & effort to get the job done. If you are an average male, probably not an issue. I’m a middle aged female (who works out) but it required effort on my part. Still easier than using a ladder & lopers. They do offer a strap to help distribute weight. Contact Greenworks & they’ll tell you how to purchase
customer_reviews.author: Difficult to impress

customer_reviews.title: Glad a bought it

customer_reviews.title: Blade was poor quality machined steel and locked up in first 3 minutes of use.
customer_reviews.text: Blade was poor quality machined steel not de-burred or hardened. Locked up in first 3 minutes of use trimming a soft decorative shrub. Had to return, because the steel burrs had damaged blades beyond repair. It was totally locked and useless. The overall design seemed ok, it assembled easily. But based on my experience and similar reviews of lockup stories and seeing the cheap steel and poor quality machining on the blades I would not take a replacement and I CAN NOT RECOMMEND ANYONE TAKE A CHANCE ON THIS PRODUCT.
